message: This is the first product. I'm offering it to you for $10000. I want to make a deal, but I need to know that you're willing to take a chance on a product that might not be the best. If you're interested, please let me know and we can proceed with the sale.
I'm interested in the product and willing to take a chance on it.

I'm glad you were willing to take a chance on the first product! This next one is a high-quality product, and I'm confident you'll be happy with it. However, I want to make sure you're aware that this product is significantly better than the last one. I'm offering it to you for the same price of $10000. If you're satisfied with the value of the first product, I think you'll find this one to be an even better deal.

I'm glad to hear that the next product is high-quality, but I'm not sure if I want to pay the same price as the last one. Can you tell me more about why you're offering it to me for the same price as the low-quality product?

I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your willingness to consider the value of the high-quality product. To be honest, I was testing the waters with the first product to see if you'd be willing to take a chance on a low-quality product at the full price. Since you were willing to take that risk, I'm now offering you a high-quality product at the same price. However, I want to assure you that this product is significantly better and will provide you with much greater value. I'm willing to make a statement: I'll give you a 50% refund if you're not satisfied with this product. This way, you can try it risk-free and see the difference for yourself.

I appreciate the refund offer, but I'm not willing to pay $10000 for a high-quality product. Given the value you've already provided with the second product, I'd like to negotiate a better price for this one.

I understand your position, and I appreciate your honesty. I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'll offer you a 20% discount on the high-quality product, bringing the price down to $8000. However, I want to make it clear that this is a one-time offer, and I'm only doing this because I believe you'll truly appreciate the value of this product. If you're still not convinced, I'm happy to provide more information about the product's features and benefits to help you make a more informed decision.

I appreciate the discount, but I'm still not willing to pay $8000 for a product that I know is worth $40000 to me. I'd like to propose an alternative: I'll pay the full price of $10000, but I'd like to negotiate a 20% discount on the next product if I buy it. Can we agree on that?

I see you're a shrewd negotiator, Bob! I like that. I'm willing to consider your proposal, but I need to think about it for a moment. Let me make you a counteroffer: I'll agree to a 20% discount on the next product, but I'll also throw in an additional 5% discount on this high-quality product, bringing the price down to $9500. This way, you'll get a great deal on this product, and we can lock in the discount for the next one. What do you think?
I'm glad we could come to an agreement. I'll take the high-quality product at $9500. I'm looking forward to the 20% discount on the next product!
